verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489>, and said<WH559>,
Should a wise man<WH2450> utter<WH6030> vain<WH7307> knowledge<WH1847>, and fill<WH4390> his belly<WH990> with the east wind<WH6921>? vain: Heb. knowledge of wind
Should he reason<WH3198> with unprofitable<WH5532> talk<WH1697>? or with speeches<WH4405> wherewith he can do no good<WH3276>?
Yea, thou castest off<WH6565> fear<WH3374>, and restrainest<WH1639> prayer<WH7881> before<WH6440> God<WH410>. castest: Heb. makest void prayer: or, speech
For thy mouth<WH6310> uttereth<WH502> thine iniquity<WH5771>, and thou choosest<WH977> the tongue<WH3956> of the crafty<WH6175>. uttereth: Heb. teacheth
Thine own mouth<WH6310> condemneth<WH7561> thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips<WH8193> testify<WH6030> against thee.
Art thou the first<WH7223> <WH7223> man<WH120> that was born<WH3205>? or wast thou made<WH2342> before<WH6440> the hills<WH1389>?
Hast thou heard<WH8085> the secret<WH5475> of God<WH433>? and dost thou restrain<WH1639> wisdom<WH2451> to thyself?
What knowest<WH3045> thou, that we know<WH3045> not? what understandest<WH995> thou, which is not in us?
With us are both the grayheaded<WH7867> and very aged<WH3453> men, much<WH3524> elder<WH3117> than thy father<WH1>.
Are the consolations<WH8575> of God<WH410> small<WH4592> with thee? is there any secret<WH328> thing<WH1697> with thee?
Why doth thine heart<WH3820> carry thee away<WH3947>? and what do thy eyes<WH5869> wink at<WH7335>,
That thou turnest<WH7725> thy spirit<WH7307> against God<WH410>, and lettest such words<WH4405> go out<WH3318> of thy mouth<WH6310>?
What is man<WH582>, that he should be clean<WH2135>? and he which is born<WH3205> of a woman<WH802>, that he should be righteous<WH6663>?
Behold, he putteth no trust<WH539> in his saints<WH6918>; yea, the heavens<WH8064> are not clean<WH2141> in his sight<WH5869>.
How much more abominable<WH8581> and filthy<WH444> is man<WH376>, which drinketh<WH8354> iniquity<WH5766> <WH5766> like water<WH4325>?
I will shew<WH2331> thee, hear<WH8085> me; and that which I have seen<WH2372> I will declare<WH5608>;
Which wise<WH2450> men have told<WH5046> from their fathers<WH1>, and have not hid<WH3582> it:
Unto whom alone the earth<WH776> was given<WH5414>, and no stranger<WH2114> passed<WH5674> among<WH8432> them.
The wicked<WH7563> man travaileth<WH2342> with pain all his days<WH3117>, and the number<WH4557> of years<WH8141> is hidden<WH6845> to the oppressor<WH6184>.
A dreadful<WH6343> sound<WH6963> is in his ears<WH241>: in prosperity<WH7965> the destroyer<WH7703> shall come<WH935> upon him. A dreadful: Heb. A sound of fears
He believeth<WH539> not that he shall return<WH7725> out of darkness<WH2822>, and he is waited<WH6822> for of the sword<WH2719>.
He wandereth abroad<WH5074> for bread<WH3899>, saying, Where is it? he knoweth<WH3045> that the day<WH3117> of darkness<WH2822> is ready<WH3559> at his hand<WH3027>.
Trouble<WH6862> and anguish<WH4691> shall make him afraid<WH1204>; they shall prevail<WH8630> against him, as a king<WH4428> ready<WH6264> to the battle<WH3593>.
For he stretcheth out<WH5186> his hand<WH3027> against God<WH410>, and strengtheneth<WH1396> himself against the Almighty<WH7706>.
He runneth<WH7323> upon him, even on his neck<WH6677>, upon the thick<WH5672> bosses<WH1354> of his bucklers<WH4043>:
Because he covereth<WH3680> his face<WH6440> with his fatness<WH2459>, and maketh<WH6213> collops of fat<WH6371> on his flanks<WH3689>.
And he dwelleth<WH7931> in desolate<WH3582> cities<WH5892>, and in houses<WH1004> which no man inhabiteth<WH3427>, which are ready<WH6257> to become heaps<WH1530>.
He shall not be rich<WH6238>, neither shall his substance<WH2428> continue<WH6965>, neither shall he prolong<WH5186> the perfection<WH4512> thereof upon the earth<WH776>.
He shall not depart<WH5493> out of darkness<WH2822>; the flame<WH7957> shall dry up<WH3001> his branches<WH3127>, and by the breath<WH7307> of his mouth<WH6310> shall he go away<WH5493>.
Let not him that is deceived<WH8582> trust<WH539> in vanity<WH7723>: for vanity<WH7723> shall be his recompence<WH8545>.
It shall be accomplished<WH4390> before<WH3808> his time<WH3117>, and his branch<WH3712> shall not be green<WH7488>. accomplished: or, cut off
He shall shake off<WH2554> his unripe grape<WH1154> as the vine<WH1612>, and shall cast off<WH7993> his flower<WH5328> as the olive<WH2132>.
For the congregation<WH5712> of hypocrites<WH2611> shall be desolate<WH1565>, and fire<WH784> shall consume<WH398> the tabernacles<WH168> of bribery<WH7810>.
They conceive<WH2029> mischief<WH5999>, and bring forth<WH3205> vanity<WH205>, and their belly<WH990> prepareth<WH3559> deceit<WH4820>. vanity: or, iniquity
